Justification: To check for anemia, infection, or other hematological issues that could contribute to fatigue.
To assess thyroid hormone levels, as hypothyroidism can cause fatigue and weight changes.
To evaluate kidney function, electrolyte levels, and glucose levels, which can affect energy levels.
To assess liver health, as liver dysfunction can lead to fatigue and loss of appetite.
To check for deficiencies that can cause fatigue and other symptoms.
To rule out urinary tract infections or other renal issues that could contribute to fatigue.
To evaluate for any underlying lung issues that could be causing fatigue.
To assess heart rhythm and rule out any cardiac issues that could be contributing to fatigue.
